boardgame.name: Iron Horse
Metro
boardgame.description: Similar to Streetcar, Tsuro, Tantrix and Spaghetti Junction, this game has players putting square tiles onto the board to form rail lines. The major difference in this game, however, is that players are not striving to make short, direct routes like those sought in Streetcar. Instead, the object of the game is to make the rail lines as long as possible. Players start with a number of trains ringing the board. Whenever a tile placement connects a train to a station (either on the edge or the center of the board), that train is removed and the player scores one point for each tile that the route crosses, which can cause one tile to score multiple times if the track loops around. However, players score double for city connections, which are the stations in the center of the board._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game was originally issued as Iron Horse (not to be confused with Iron Horse)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Cable Car_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Number of players: 2-6 Age of players: 8+ Length: 45 minutes Game Description: The eve of the 1900 World’s Fair is approaching, and excavations are taking place across the city. Bizarre-looking scaffolds arise everywhere. Tunnels are built in the streets to later be covered with earth.Take part in the construction of the Paris Metro! Each player works to complete a set of lines across Paris and scores points based on the length of the lines - after all, we want to show the tourists as much of our fine city as possible. When you complete your lines, you tally your points and the player with the most points when the fair opens, is the winner! Author: Dirk Henn

Queen Games (QNG60159F) Paris 1898. Work is beginning on building the Metropolitan. Who can build the longest Metro line? The players put their Metro carriages on the starting stations and the game begins. The players lay their tracks piece by piece to build lines from their own station to any of the other stations, trying to make the lines as long as possible. The longer the line, the more points the player gets when it is finished. If your line ends in the middle of the board you double your points. But with skillful building the lines of the other players can also be shortened - great fun for the whole family.

Queen Games (QNG60159F) Paris 1898. Work is beginning on building the Metropolitan. Who can build the longest Metro line? The players put their Metro carriages on the starting stations and the game begins. The players lay their tracks piece by piece to build lines from their own station to any of the other stations, trying to make the lines as long as possible. The longer the line, the more points the player gets when it is finished. If your line ends in the middle of the board you double your points. But with skillful building the lines of the other players can also be shortened - great fun for the whole family.
